pr_title: [DataStore] query API changes with pagination support

timeline.message: query pagination api and pagination groundwork
fix checkstyle errors and improve documentation

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe, matchAll(), to disambiguate from "apply all of the options"?
Elsewhere, we use WhateverOptions.defaults(), too. That's become sort of a convention at this point.
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams
jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText:
I like the concept of the Where as a class to avoid the static imports (even though I'm torn about the reasons why the Java community perceives static imports a something generally bad).
I updated the readme with more details and will push an update to this PR introducing this way to build the DSL.
replies.author: drochetti

timeline.bodyText: If it is not intended for these values to ever be null, I think you could use int instead of Integer, everywhere in the class.
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

+package com.amplifyframework.core.model.query;
+
+import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
+
+import java.util.Objects;
+
+/**
+ * A simple data structure that holds pagination information that can be applied queries.
+ */
+public class QueryPaginationInput {
+
+    /**
+     * The default page size.
+     */
+    public static final Integer DEFAULT_LIMIT = 100;
+
+    private final Integer page;
+    private final Integer limit;
+
+    private QueryPaginationInput(@NonNull Integer page, @NonNull Integer limit) {
+        this.page = page;
+        this.limit = limit;

timeline.bodyText: Can we use the term "page size", instead of limit? "limit" is ambiguous. It would either be a max results, or a number of results per page. I guess here it means limit for each page.
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText: Can you uncomment it, and assert the non-null state, now that you have @NonNull? Also thank you for making this API improvement. The null-ness of this param has always bothered me.
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText:
I like this style, but I'd change the method names for the pagination. To me, this would be more clear:
Where.allMatch().paginated(startAtPage(0).withPageSize(pageSize))

Or:
Where.allMatch().paginated(intoPagesOfSize(pageSize).startingAtPage(0))

Or:
Where.allMatch().paginated(intoPagesSized(pageSize).startingAtPage(0))
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText: I like your suggestion better than the current implementation. My only concern is that JS went GA with the page/limit pagination API. I'm not strongly opposed to change it into something more expressive, but I'd say we should align iOS and Android in that case.
replies.author: drochetti

timeline.message: fix pagination bindings and add missing javadoc
add missing equals, hashCode and toString methods
